snippet: The legislation would require tough border measures to be in place before illegal immigrants could take the first steps to become American citizens.
abstract: Bipartisan group of senators largely agrees on broad immigration bill that would require tough border measures to be in place before illegal immigrants could take first steps to become American citizens; bill does not impose any specific measurements of border enforcement results that, if they were not met, would stop immigrants from moving toward citizenship.

byline.original: By JULIA PRESTON and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: The legislation would require tough border measures to be in place before illegal immigrants could take the first steps to become American citizens.

headline.seo: Senators’ Group Reaches Deal on Immigration
headline.main: Broad Outlines of Senate Immigration Agreement Emerge
headline.print_headline: Bipartisan Senators’ Group Reaches Deal on Immigration Bill
